website_summaries.verdict: Buyers needing a 3-tier utility cart at an affordable price will be impressed with this all-purpose piece by Trinity.
pros: Resistant to rust, stains, and dents
Each shelf is able to hold 100 pounds with weight evenly distributed
Cart features handlebar on both sides for easy maneuvering
cons: A few buyers had durability issues

customer_reviews.title: It worked pretty well with the Camp Chef OS-144 movie screen
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a utility cart to place my projector. It worked pretty well with the Camp Chef OS-144 movie screen. Assembly wise you really have to hammer the poles in hard, to make them go in flush. I tried using my body weight to push down on it and one of the wheels bent out of shape. So I recommend you put on the wheels last... I do like the wheel brakes and I do like the lip on each tray, which helps secure the equipment.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: A sturdy cart at a good price. There are some assembly challenges..
customer_reviews.text: The assembly instructions are very brief and for the most part are helpful. Attaching the wheels, however require some care. I used a hammer and a short wood dowel to set the wheels as a final step. The user will find that you cannot force the wheels down tightly without turning the assembled cart upside down and using the hammer and dowel gently drive the wheels tightly into the leg sockets. The leg sockets could be damaged by not driving the metal leg posts straight into the plastic housing. Once assembled and all gaps closed the cart is a solid sturdy product.
customer_reviews.author: C. F. Crowe

customer_reviews.title: Light Duty Only
customer_reviews.text: The shelves are very flexible and flimsy. They will sag from even moderate weight. The casters are higher quality than expected. Assembly was easy. Expect to use a rubber mallet to hammer the sections together. I would have paid more for better engineered shelves.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: 2 out of 3 broke within a month
customer_reviews.text: They are nice carts but not durable. I am past the return time but two of the three that I bought for a restaurant are broken on the top shelf. Just from putting moderately heavy things on top such as metal pitchers of water and coffee chafing urns. Both carts have large cracks on the plastic top shelf and are pretty much unusable. Very disappointing as the other carts we had are dirty and old but still sturdy as can be. Nice carts if you don't want to use anything heavy on them.
customer_reviews.author: mary brand

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say this was ordered on Friday and I recieved it that Sunday! I just couldn’t believe it! I have never recieved anything by mail on a Sunday! I was anxious to put it together. This was the easiest thing to put together! The only FYI I have to tell is to make certain the wheels are put all the way in! I used a hammer with a towel to get them all the way in.... flush to the foundation. Cart is very sturdy and holds a lot! I recommend this product and company!
customer_reviews.author: Connie Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great for light jobs
customer_reviews.text: It's fine for light weight stuff like taking dishes to & from the kitchen or laundry, but any more than about 15 or 20 lbs & the wheels fold under.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Blanton

customer_reviews.title: Too fragile.
customer_reviews.text: This cart would probably be a good deal if you plan to only use it for extremely lightweight items and only occasionally. However I only had mine for two weeks and only for lightweight power tools and the receptacle for the castor cracked and now the cart is a bit unstable.
customer_reviews.author: Carlton W.

customer_reviews.title: Better description of the measurements are needed, overall good quality
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and this is a good value. The dimensions that I was reading from the comments and product description are not accurate. It didn't fit in the space I had originally intended for it. The handles do come off and here, I pulled out my tape measure: WITHOUT HANDLES: 28"wide x 35.25"tall / WITH HANDLES: 32"wide x 36.5"tall
customer_reviews.author: Brian coe

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage. The plastic holes where the metal bars attach were all kinds of messed up, had to use a hair dryer to melt it back into place so the bars would fit. The plastic cracked when putting the wheels on making them loose and wobbly. The locking wheels also don't work. Do not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Dan E.

customer_reviews.title: The cart itself is fine, but when it arrived
customer_reviews.text: The cart itself is fine, but when it arrived, box undamaged, the second shelf was broken. I needed it for a different purpose and had no time to wait for a replacement, so I repaired it and made it work, but the fact that it arrived damaged was less than helpful and quite frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: S.Y. Shin

customer_reviews.title: Great little cart.
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for a file trolley in smaller office. Box arrived on time and in good shape. Easy to assemble, I estimate took me about 10-15 minutes and end product is sturdy. I highly recommend using a 'deadfall(club) hammer' as it eased tapping the pieces together. If you don't have a deadfall hammer I suggest you get one if you're into buying 'easy' to assemble furniture on any kind. They are great persuaders and don't easily mar surfaces..
customer_reviews.author: Charles H.

customer_reviews.title: Very useful.  I am not paying two hundred for rubber maid.
customer_reviews.text: I purchase two carts. They have held up quite well for several years of every day use. We don’t carry any thing not unless we have to. They were easy to put together. It does take a hammer to install the wheels but do not be heavy handed.
customer_reviews.author: Yellow Rose

customer_reviews.title: Very nice cart!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this cart! The first one I ordered came with a broken part, however. It was in an undamaged box so I think that the QC group missed it. However, I initiated a return through Amazon and once again, Amazon customer service came to the rescue. They shipped me a new cart and I had to return the old one. Once I got this one put together and moving, it is a wonderful lightweight cart. It rolls smoothly and two of the wheels lock if needed. I think that this a a solid buy and I highly recommend this to you.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hodge

customer_reviews.title: perfect cart.
customer_reviews.text: I chose this cart because of the favorable reviews...and the answers to questions from other users. How to knock in the casters was very helpful as between my daughter and I there was not a lot of muscle. We used a piece of wood and hammer and knocked those babies right in. I like it because it's lightweight but sturdy and rolls easily... even over a thick rug. I bought this cart for my husband who is on peritoneal dialysis. It is perfect for the PD machine (25 pounds) and all the other medical supplies needed. Once its set up I will take a photo to help other folks looking for a lightweight but sturdy rolling cart for PD.
customer_reviews.author: Karren

customer_reviews.title: It Rolls great
customer_reviews.text: It was a little difficult to put together at first. It didn't come with any instructions. But I figured it out and it works beautifully! I have COPD and congestive heart failure and I have a very hard time carrying even a plate of food and still having enough breath so I push my food to where I needed to go on this card and it's wonderful it saves a lot of heavy breathing and the saves a lot of energy being expended
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Courson

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the worst cart I have ever used. Poor quality and handling is terrible. One of the bases snapped upon inserting the caster and one of the casters has bearings which are stuck causing it not to spin. Makes a ton of noise when pushed on even, solid flooring as well. Not to be used in an office building unless you can make a ton of noise.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Mercer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't really stay together
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for work. It was easy to put together but it doesn't say together. I would have needed to glue this for it to stay. I would have thought it would have been better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dominguez

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these to use as a portable office/study center, and then bought a second one for an office organizer for my husband. The wheels were a little stubborn to install properly, but once they were inserted with some tough love, the carts are very sturdy. After graduation, I'll either repurpose my cart as a grilling station on the patio or buy another cart for the patio. I expect we'll find many uses for these handy contraptions.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Slightly compact compared to other models (its just enough so ...
customer_reviews.text: Slightly compact compared to other models (its just enough so you cant put a full sheet lexan on the bottom two shelves. In catering that's an important thing to know) but gets the job done and cant beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: corey p bailey

customer_reviews.title: Thank you can I have another.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I'm looking for an excuse to buy another. I used it to hold tools while working on the car or tools while working on projects around the house. It is a bit difficult to put together. The tolerance are to close. You'll have to bang the post pretty hard and some plastic will scrape off. But its very strong and rolls smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: GemAPeel

customer_reviews.title: Great Sturdy Cart - Good Value
customer_reviews.text: This card is wonderful. Easy to assemble, sturdy and it rolls very very easily. Great for stacking all my stuff on when I'm doing household projects. I did need a hammer to assemble but no big deal. Just a couple of taps and everything fit together. Very snuggly. This card is not wobbly because of that.
customer_reviews.author: BCP

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy plastic cart
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for the office and upon assembly when trying to insert the casters (which was near impossible) the plastic split at the base where the casters are inserted. Contacted seller and got a replacement cart. Still had a heck of a time getting the casters in on the new cart and even then couldn't get them pushed all the way into place. Welp, just put a few 12 packs of soda on the top and the casters snapped right out of the plastic that holds them. Cheap cart and the shelves sagged too.
customer_reviews.author: LRD

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy cart
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put all my counter appliances on and it fit them all. I then bought a barbecue cover to keep the dust off and I put it in a closet. Now when I want an appliances or appliances, I just wheel it from the closet to the kitchen and don't even have to take them off the cart. My kitchen counters now are free of appliance clutter. Oh, I even put it together easily and I got a friend to buy one too. I love Amazon and their prices. Have been delighted with everything I bought.
customer_reviews.author: catmarday

customer_reviews.title: This cart was easy to assemble although the wheels don't truly click into ...
customer_reviews.text: This cart was easy to assemble although the wheels don't truly click into place. In spite of this it is stable, a nice large size. Also nice is one side of shelf does't have a lip on it if you have something like a towel warmer with door that needs to swing open you can.
customer_reviews.author: Kim E

customer_reviews.title: it's perfect, cheap-n-cheerful for this project and then will get ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a cheap and temporary use: holding various tools during a remodel job. Helps to be able to wheel it over to a work area and then back out of the way. But i knew when I bought it that it's not commercial grade and will not hold up getting banged around and overloaded with weight, which is what I'm doing. SO, it's perfect, cheap-n-cheerful for this project and then will get thrown away after I beat the crap out of it.
customer_reviews.author: beanie99

customer_reviews.title: Nice cart to use for utility purposes
customer_reviews.text: Nice cart to use for utility purposes. I bought for my admin at work, and she loves using to deliver supplies and use for some of her projects that require lifting.
customer_reviews.author: GJ

customer_reviews.title: It is a great cart for the price
customer_reviews.text: I am a chef and I use the cart to transport ingredients from a culinary school to my car and the home or to places I do cooking demos. It is a great cart for the price. They only thing I don't like about it is the steel posts come loose over time. If I hit a bump in a sidewalk or a paved driveway and try to lift the cart, that whole layer of shelving can come undone. You just have to be aware of that. Other wise, great product. Lightweight and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: K. J. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 5 weeks
customer_reviews.text: This has not been used for anything heavy and is only used 1-2 times/week - on week five the plastic frame that holds the wheel in broke and it is not usable. I would not recommend - would be more durable if there was a metal reinforcement that the wheel slid into?
customer_reviews.author: Penny Munn

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy it
customer_reviews.text: This was not worth the money..it should have been proved around $40..one of the wheels was larger than the other ....Buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: suga1

customer_reviews.title: Good medium duty cart - We bought several different types ...
customer_reviews.text: Good medium duty cart - We bought several different types for our home brewing operation - This is one that is still in use for medium weight equipment. The light duty carts didn't make it for very long.
customer_reviews.author: phorton58

customer_reviews.title: Re-buy may be a rip off...but it's a great cart!
customer_reviews.text: I loved the cart and went to re-buy only to find that the buy again button doesn't mean the same price. It had almost doubled and I was disappointed to learn nothing could be done. The carts are holding up OK, but are not as stellar as I would have hoped. The joints pop open when I lift the cart slightly to cross a threshhold.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Bruce

customer_reviews.title: I can work easily from the cart and wheel it back to storage ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm repainting rooms in my house and needed a utility cart to house tools, chemicals, supplies and paint. I can work easily from the cart and wheel it back to storage whenever I have delays in the project. Once I finish the painting project, I see this as useful for any project where I need to be able to move between rooms and storage area. I am considering ordering a second.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Roberson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cart to hold all medical supplies and equipment in ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect cart to hold all medical supplies and equipment in one place. My son attached a power strip so that we can plug the equipment into it and move the cart from room to room.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wight

customer_reviews.title: I bought a simular cart that performs much better and costs a few dollars less
customer_reviews.text: handles comes off, one of the wheels locks up, top shelf center part dips even though I did not carry around anything heavy!! I bought a simular cart that performs much better and costs a few dollars less...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We almost returned this. Upon taking it apart and ...
customer_reviews.text: We almost returned this. Upon taking it apart and putting it back together again, the wheels magically all met the ground equally. Before, there was a wheel that was not flush to the ground making the whole thing wobble. Now it suits our needs!
customer_reviews.author: Marco

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Nice little cart and good value. We had part of it with hidden damage in shipping but they promptly sent replacement parts direct from factory.
customer_reviews.author: Walker

customer_reviews.title: This cart was not easily assembled.  I was not able to attach the wheels.
customer_reviews.text: A friend has put my cart together for me. She's lots younger than I am and was able to put the locking wheel in place. Even she had to struggle; I wouldn't have stood a chance! One if the top horizonal rails is broken. Was when it arrived. So I have a two layer cart with only one side with a top handle. I can return the handle if you want to see it. I would like to have a replacement handle. Please advise. Thanks. Joyce Koch
customer_reviews.author: Joyce E Koch

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Plastic
customer_reviews.text: This cart looked nice and lasted exactly one week. I work in a mental health office and it was used to transport charts that are made up of 3-ring binders. Within one week it had broken and was impossible to repair. Very cheap plastic and completely unable to transport anything of weight.
customer_reviews.author: jd_wanderer03

customer_reviews.title: Assembly problems...
customer_reviews.text: The assembly was a little annoying. Everything just snaps and locks together, except the wheels.... "Insert peg into hole" but the peg was bigger than the hole... So my wheels still aren't all the way on. I managed to hammer the metal peg into the plastic hole about halfway, and the cart works fine and rolls, but I don't think I can put very much weight on it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this 5 stars, but we had some difficulty inserting the rollers until they "locked" and one of them still pops out at inopportune moments. Nevertheless, it is a real boon to a small but VERY busy office - moving files from one location to another and for taking our large collection of orchids to the kitchen for their weekly watering.
customer_reviews.author: L. Buglion

customer_reviews.title: Can't get the casters inserted....
customer_reviews.text: I would love to know how you get the casters inserted?? I haven't been able to insert them and with that being said I can't use this? I would like to return this or get new casters that I will be able to insert.
customer_reviews.author: Carmel Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not for industrial use but great around the house/garage!
customer_reviews.text: First let me say this a great light-duty cart. Do not overload it and you will be fine! Assembly is super easy, but you will need a plastic mallet and piece of wood to hammer the legs down flush. The wood is so you don't damage the plastic with the mallet, just tap it down until it sits flat and it will make assembly a breeze. (Took me less than 5 min to setup completely). I use this as a detailing cart to keep all the chemicals/tools organized and WOULD RECOMMEND this for anything under 100lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle James Edwards

customer_reviews.title: EXCELENT WORK CART FOR A DIALYSIS MACHINE
customer_reviews.text: THIS CART HAS THE EXTRA ROOM FOR A BIN FOR SUPPLIES, AND A PLACE FOR DRAIN BAGS. WITH SOME SIDE HOOKS TO HOLD THE EXTRA FLUID BAG, THIS WORKS BETTER THEN THE CART SUPPLIED BY THE DIALYSIS CENTER ITSELF. MY DIALYSIS AT WORK HAS NEVER BEEN EASIER, I LOVE THIS CART.
customer_reviews.author: JONATHAN L KUNKLE

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Not easily assembled a lot of my poles would not fully attach where they should. Plastic was shaved off pouting them made a mess the floor. Very cheaply made not sturdy. Will work as a light dinner serving cart
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn D.

customer_reviews.title: I love this cart for my classroom!
customer_reviews.text: I use this cart in my classroom to hold the student lunches. At lunch time I just wheel the cart into the hall and they can grab them without disturbing my other class. Easy to put together...it only took me about 10 minutes to snap it together. I did use a hammer to help me get the tightest fit on the legs though. Great cart, looks good, and does exactly what I need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: J. J.

customer_reviews.title: Utility cart, good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight all purpose cart. Had a difficult time attaching the wheels to the bottom shelf but that is probably because I am not very strong. Had to use a hammer to help me assemble the cart. As stated by a previous reviewer, I also could not get the metal sleeves to completely set down on the shelves so my cart is a little taller than expected. No big deal, doesn't interfere with its use. The shelves measure approximately 16 x 24.5 inches and is about 3 feet in height measuring from the top of the shelf to the ground (not including height of handles).
customer_reviews.author: WL

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This cart is better than I anticipated. It is lightweight, sturdy, and has brakes! Speaking of brakes, I left it on and wore a tire out... Other than myself making the mistake, I have to order a replacement wheel... This is perfect! I would definitely recommend this for anyone in need of a cart for multi-purpose use.
customer_reviews.author: Agie

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap look but it will do for a short. Of time
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap look but it will do for a short. Of directions was not good I had to go on YouTube to find how to set it up
customer_reviews.author: ReginaHarris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Easy to assemble, except for the wheels. Take a lot of strength to get them in securely.
customer_reviews.author: donna royall

customer_reviews.title: Broke first day...
customer_reviews.text: Wheels snapped cheap plastic hole at bottom. had to pay 28$ to return...
customer_reviews.author: james lewis

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as adveritsed, very happy
customer_reviews.text: This solved a problem in a small area behind the bar in the great room. It is sturdy, holds a microwave and the shelves are very generous for other additonal items..Im very happy with how its constructed, it was easy to put together, and is just as it looks. Very nice, very sturdy and just what I wanted for the price.
customer_reviews.author: readingisfun

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy! Not to difficult to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy! Not to difficult to assemble, and it has save me many a step!
customer_reviews.author: Janet Yancey

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal
customer_reviews.text: It went together with no problems, despite to confusing over engineered pictorial simplified directions...;o] We use it to transport groceries from garage to kitchen. Usually one trip is needed except when I buy 4-6 cases of bottled water, which make it on a separate trip... no problems as of 2 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Nice Cart
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my sister and she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Assembled easily without tools
customer_reviews.text: Assembled easily without tools. One side of each tray has no lip or edge - will not hold liquid spills. Rolls easily. All four wheels swivel/caster. Nice size for use in a condo for by parents that can't carry things. They use it to get dishes from the kitchen to the table.
customer_reviews.author: jd

customer_reviews.title: Just as described
customer_reviews.text: This cart arrived today. It is light-weight, but will hold plenty of weight. I had it together in 15 minutes using the assembly tips posted by another reviewer (use the rubber mallet, a block of wood, and some spray lubricant). I had absolutely no problems with assembly and this will fit my needs perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Deb B.

customer_reviews.title: Rollers came off.
customer_reviews.text: With in few days the grove holds the roller cracked. The roller won’t stay in place. How do I get a replacement bottom rack?
customer_reviews.author: Kavitha

customer_reviews.title: Convenient Cart
customer_reviews.text: Good product. I use it as a Medical Supply cart. It is reasonably priced. Takes a little work to install the casters but it is otherwise easy to put together. It is not too heavy and rolls from place to place easily. This would also be well used for almost any use for someone who does not want wire racks or spend alot of money.
customer_reviews.author: Zippy

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: For very light weight duty. Shelves will bow under minimal weight. not a durable product. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Many Uses
customer_reviews.text: Just the right size for rolling in and out of home hallways. Totally helps in decluttering - removing items from closets, etc., to sort them. Know it will have many other uses, but it is great for what I am doing now. Sturdy yet lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: handy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Received very quickly. Has been sturdy and exceptionally handy. I work in the food industry and it handles a lot of constant use.
customer_reviews.author: Terrie Statum

customer_reviews.title: amazing versatile in all the uses I can think up ...
customer_reviews.text: amazing versatile in all the uses I can think up for this mobile shelf.. used for xmas gatherings and went into my shop where is was intended to be. rugged and user friendly! great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: barry w

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, difficult to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality cart, only one complaint. Putting this together was a bear. The connections are so tight, you have to bang for days with a hammer or mallet. I used a soft mallet and broke a small piece of plastic off. Didn't affect anything but just too difficult to get the wheels in place.
customer_reviews.author: R. Harlow

customer_reviews.title: the instructions are easy but some of the pieces were not properly fitted/tapered ...
customer_reviews.text: the instructions are easy but some of the pieces were not properly fitted/tapered so it took A LOT of muscle to get this put together.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my dad to use in his retirement home because he needed some extra space for a coffee maker, toaster etc. His little kitchen really only have a small counter and it's used by the microwave. I assembled it myself. Love the quality of casters and the notched out handle. Makes moving it around very easy. Very nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Cherry L. Clifford

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, looks nice and functional
customer_reviews.text: It is perfect. It is very sturdy and has lots of room. We use it for my husband’s at home dialysis treatments. Keeps everything organized. Got shelves at Target that work beautifully on it.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene

customer_reviews.title: How Did I Live Without This Cart!
customer_reviews.text: I am an African Violet hobbyist and currently have about 150 plants on various light stands throughout the house! Have all my supplies on this cart and just wheel it from room to room to care for my "kids". So much easier and has saved me not only time, but mess to clean up!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Mann

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for my husbands at home dialysis recycler and all his supplies....nice that it is on wheels so we can put it away when he is done with it!! Would definitely recommend and the price is great too...shipping was quick and honestly my 7 year old granddaughter put the whole thing together herself! :)
customer_reviews.author: Kim Holderness

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my artist studio.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cart to use in my art studio. It arrived quickly, was very easy to assemble and is just what I was looking for. The height and size of the top shelf allow me to use it for my palette and all my paints, brushes and other supplies fit neatly on the lower shelves. It is lightweight and easy to maneuver, but still very sturdy. Very happy that I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great cart. Easy to put together. Works great. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The quality is pretty good with the brakes and metal bars that are ...
customer_reviews.text: So convenient to use for tools and moving stuff around. Saves time and strength. The quality is pretty good with the brakes and metal bars that are attached and easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Justin C Tung

customer_reviews.title: cheap construction
customer_reviews.text: While the 3 shelves and 8 supports were easy to install, the caster wheels would not go in without bashing them in with a hammer. The wheels did not go in all the way, but at least they will roll and won't come off easily. For the price, its ok, but I can't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: g rasalan

customer_reviews.title: Wheels were hard to put on
customer_reviews.text: I'm not going to lie it was hard putting the wheels on, but I just hammered them on and it went well. Other than that it was really easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Dominique Williamson

customer_reviews.title: ... and the office loves them they seem strong and easy to put
customer_reviews.text: Recived them quick and the office loves them they seem strong and easy to put together
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did not last
customer_reviews.text: The cart broke after using 4 times. I am a baker and it ruined a couple hundred dollars of my product.
customer_reviews.author: BH

customer_reviews.title: This is a great cart. The plastic is quite thick and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cart. The plastic is quite thick and sturdy, not some flimsy crap. The wheels are heavy duty, not your typical minimum quality. They are more industrial oriented and the brakes work well. Assembly is straight forward and aided with the use of a rubber mallet or a 2x4 and regular hammer. Leave the wheels until last so the cart dosen't skate around during assembly. Well worth the price and I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sixty Something

customer_reviews.title: 3 tier utility cart
customer_reviews.text: Very stury cart on big thick wheels. Very sturdy cart for what I use it for. I put it near my husbands bed so he can go on the laptop and view his image on a 24" monitor as he is bed-ridden. Monitor on the top level, laptop on second level. Movies or DVDs on the third level. Mouse and pad on his bed by his hand. Im very pleased with cart. It has many uses. You wont be disappointed with it.
customer_reviews.author: MeMe

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: A little hard to put together. The wheels don’t go in all the way.
customer_reviews.author: S.M.

customer_reviews.title: Great cart. Very easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Great cart. Very easy to assemble. I use this for a project cart when I am working on things around the house as a place to put my tools and materials for the job. The wheel brakes are handy to keep the cart in place.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: SERVED THE PURPOSE!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to support food, dishes, etc. for a backyard party. Was more than adequate. Now I use it in den to temporarily store all sorts of items for projects, etc. Used to hold a fan, mail--you name it. Lightweight but sturdy. W heels make it easy to move around house and yard.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S.

customer_reviews.title: good buy
customer_reviews.text: Its easy to put together and holds up great so far
customer_reviews.author: LA S.

customer_reviews.title: This cart seems a little flimsy because it's mostly made ...
customer_reviews.text: This cart seems a little flimsy because it's mostly made of hard plastic. One of the casters proved difficult to insert and I'm just hoping that the cart won't collapse. Otherwise, the price was right and the cart arrived on schedule.
customer_reviews.author: K. B. Hall

customer_reviews.title: 3 TIER CART
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful multi-purpose cart that is heavy duty and extremely useful; very mobile; I am going to buy at least one more; I've checked prices at restaurant supply houses and found this to be the best price.
customer_reviews.author: DJBRUCEK

customer_reviews.title: Great utility cart for office or home-sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Good working cart cart for home or office. Sturdy metal and heavy plastic, but not too heavy to move around including stairs if necessary. Put together yourself, but is tight so does not wiggle apart with use. Easy to clean even when used outside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Frequent Flyer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works great to move things around the office for meetings
customer_reviews.author: STEPHEN MASTER

customer_reviews.title: Not as sturdy as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: Not as sturdy as I hoped, but serviceable and inexpensive. If you buy it, make sure you bang the wheels in, I used a rubber mallet, and glue the handles on. The pressure fit isn't enough to keep them attached if the cart is loaded.
customer_reviews.author: Bernie Berman

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: Received this today. Product arrived broken and scratched/chipped. I do not have high hopes for the durability here on out.....
customer_reviews.author: Chris E.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: we actually bought 4 of the carts total very nice cart at a good price
customer_reviews.author: GEN

customer_reviews.title: Great cart. Time to buy a 3rd one
customer_reviews.text: I use this cart for transporting my medical equipment across rooms. Great cart. Time to buy a 3rd one.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Linauer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, rolls smoothly, and will be used for many years to come!
customer_reviews.author: 4ksuwildcats

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Office!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our office so we could carry lots of things (folders, drinks, food, supplies) to meeting rooms both inside and outside (we have a large conference room in our building that we sometimes rent for big events). This cart is great! Lightweight, easy to push/pull and maneuver, yet sturdy as well. I also use it to cart cases of water and tea from the storage closet to the frig - what a back saver! Their customer service is excellent, too - the bottom tray cracked when we tried to push one of the wheels in (I think the opening was manufactured too small), and they sent a replacement immediately!
customer_reviews.author: KEF

customer_reviews.title: Great for general use.
customer_reviews.text: The top shelf is not perfectly flat, is sags in the middle. This causes a little bit of a problem when uses a projector (my use), but probably wouldn't be a big deal for others. Easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: MalakJoe

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Great cart! So easy to put together! Bought 2 more!
customer_reviews.author: A. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Only for light weight stuff
customer_reviews.text: Not the best quality. Wheels suck. Get what ya pay for kinda product
customer_reviews.author: Joe Noren

customer_reviews.title: Great for estheticians
customer_reviews.text: I'm an Esthetician, and have struggled to find a sturdy and affordable waxing cart. This was perfect. It was also easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Jaide Glenn

customer_reviews.title: It is not easy to put together.  Had to have a mallet and muscle.
customer_reviews.text: Great price on this product. Wish it were easier to put together. But, would probably order another one if I needed it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Sturdy enough
customer_reviews.text: The wheels keep on falling off, one wheel was defected, couldn't even went in and Amazon sent me another one for replacement. It is not heavy duty at all. I am hoping it won't fall off if we put things on it.
customer_reviews.author: b3h4ppy

customer_reviews.title: Poor Qaulity
customer_reviews.text: The cart quality is cheap. The bottom shelf came was cracked at the bottom upon delivery. Very unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: price is reflective of quality. skip it and spend more for better quality, you'll be happier.
customer_reviews.text: the wheels are not even, they make for a VERY noisy cart. its very cheaply made. stick with rubbermaid.
customer_reviews.author: Dorian Nabors

customer_reviews.title: Great produce for what I’m using it for!
customer_reviews.text: As a Medical cart for my wife’s Medical devices, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hinson

product_meta.title: Trinity 3-Tier Utility Cart
product_meta.description: TRINITY's 3-Tier Utility Cart is perfect for any garage, warehouse, office, or kitchen. With its high injection molded PP and lightweight aluminum legs, this cart resists dents, scratches, stains and rust. This versatile utility cart with swivel casters makes moving equipment and heavy loads easy in any environment.
feature_bullets: High performance injection molded PP resists dents, stains and rust
Weight capacity on wheels (evenly distributed): 100 lbs. per shelf

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars676 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
specifications.Warranty Description: 1 year hassle free replacement warranty through trinity.
